import pandas as pd
import plotly.graph_objects as go
import plotly.express as px

# Historical lobbying ROI data
lobbying_data = pd.DataFrame({
    'Sector': [
        'Defense Contractors',
        'Pharmaceutical',
        'Oil & Gas',
        'Telecommunications',
        'DIH/dFDA (Projected)'
    ],
    'Lobbying Spend (Billions)': [1.1, 4.5, 2.8, 3.2, 0.1],
    'Government Contracts/Benefits (Billions)': [2020, 450, 320, 280, 27],
    'ROI Ratio': [1836, 100, 114, 88, 270]
})

# Calculate and sort by ROI
lobbying_data = lobbying_data.sort_values('ROI Ratio')

# Create horizontal bar chart
fig = go.Figure(go.Bar(
    y=lobbying_data['Sector'],
    x=lobbying_data['ROI Ratio'],
    orientation='h',
    marker=dict(
        color=lobbying_data['ROI Ratio'],
        colorscale='Viridis',
        showscale=True,
        colorbar=dict(title='ROI Ratio')
    ),
    text=[f'{x}:1' for x in lobbying_data['ROI Ratio']],
    textposition='outside'
))

fig.update_layout(
    title='Lobbying ROI by Sector (Historical Data)',
    xaxis_title='Return on Investment (X:1)',
    yaxis_title='',
    height=400,
    xaxis_type='log',
    annotations=[
        dict(x=1836, y='Defense Contractors',
             text='Military-Industrial Complex:<br>$1.1B â†’ $2.02T',
             showarrow=True, arrowhead=2, xshift=-50)
    ]
)

fig.show()

print("\nKey Precedent: Defense contractors achieve 1,813:1 ROI on lobbying")
print("DIH Strategy: Reverse the cash flow - same mechanism, opposite direction")
